danfulea.utils

Class ScanDisk

  • java.lang.Object
    • danfulea.utils.ScanDisk

  • public class ScanDisk
extends java.lang.Object
    ScanDisk utilities. It is designed to look for a particular file/folder inside a computer
    or scan entire computer and generate a text file with file/folder structure!
    Author:
    Dan Fulea, 01 DEC. 2003

        Returns:
        the array of roots

      • getFilesAndDirs

        public static java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getFilesAndDirs(java.io.File root)
        Get files and folders from a root folder (e.g. C:\ or C:\Windows).
        Parameters:
        root - the root folder
        Returns:
        the files and folders (sub-folders not included).

      • getDirs

        public static java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getDirs(java.io.File root)
        Returns the folders from a root folder. It also counts folders and folders plus files.
        Parameters:
        root - the root folder
        Returns:
        the folders (sub-folders not included).

      • getFiles

        public static java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getFiles(java.io.File root)
        Gets files inside a root.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the files contained in root folder

      • scanDirs

        private static void scanDirs(java.io.File root,
                             java.io.FileWriter fw)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Recursively scan all folders from a root, including sub-folders. While scanning, the absolute path of folders is displayed within any class objects which implements MessageRetriever interface.

        For saving the scan result in a text file (located in application folder), it also uses the FileWriter to write the absolute path of folders.

        Parameters:
        root - the root
        fw - the FileWriter
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - can throw this exception
        See Also:
        scanDirs(File, String, Vector, boolean)

      • scanDirs

        private static void scanDirs(java.io.File root,
                             java.lang.String target,
                             java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> stock,
                             boolean case_sensitiv)
        Recursively scan all folders from a root, including sub-folders, in order to find a file or a folder.
        Parameters:
        root - the root
        target - the file we are looking for
        stock - the stock vector to store the results
        case_sensitiv - if search is case-sensitive or not
        See Also:
        scanDirs(File, FileWriter)

      • findFile

        private static void findFile(java.io.File root,
                             java.lang.String target,
                             java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> stock,
                             boolean case_sensitiv)
        Finds if a specific target file or folder is located inside the root folder. Usage of wildcard characters (which is *) is implemented!
        Parameters:
        root - the root folder
        target - the file or folder we are searching for
        stock - the stock vector to store the results
        case_sensitiv - if search is case-sensitive or not

      • createScanResultFileInCurrentDir

        public static void createScanResultFileInCurrentDir(java.io.File root)
                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Begins the scan of root folder. Creates scan result file, ScanResult.txt, in application folder. In addition, the results are passed to any class object which implements MessageRetriever interface.
        Parameters:
        root - the root folder
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - can throw this exception

      • isAvailable

        public static boolean isAvailable(java.io.File root)
        Checks if a root folder contains files or not
        Parameters:
        root - the root folder
        Returns:
        true if available, false otherwise

      • createComputerScanResultFileInCurrentDir

        public static void createComputerScanResultFileInCurrentDir()
                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Begins the computer scan. Creates scan result file, ScanResult.txt, in application folder. In addition, the results are passed to any class object which implements MessageRetriever interface.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - can throw this exception

      • scanForFile

        public static void scanForFile(java.io.File root,
                               java.lang.String target,
                               boolean case_sensitiv)
        Begins the scan of root folder in order to find a file or a folder. The results are passed to any class object which implements MessageRetriever interface.
        Parameters:
        root - The root folder to begin the search
        target - the file or folder we are looking for
        case_sensitiv - if the search is case sensitive or not.

      • scanComputerForFile

        public static void scanComputerForFile(java.lang.String target,
                                       boolean case_sensitiv)
        Begins the whole computer scan in order to find a file or a folder. The results are passed to any class object which implements MessageRetriever interface.
        Parameters:
        target - the file we are looking for
        case_sensitiv - if search is case sensitive or not

      • getDirsNum

        public static int getDirsNum()
        Returns:
        the folder counts

        public static int getFilesNum()
        Returns:
        the files counts

        Returns:
